back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull] -X, X is equal to 1 plus the number of <t>Wonderland</t>locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -3.  If you are at a [[Wonderland]] location, discard a card from your hand at random.
name: Arkham in Wonderland
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull] -X, X is equal to the number of [[Wonderland]] locations in play (max 5).
[elder_thing]: -2.  If you are at a [[Wonderland]] location, discard a card from your hand at random.

back_flavor: The city is coming apart at the seams, while shadowy creatures further unravel it by consuming anything they can tear apart.  Buildings collapse as their bricks turn into ivory dominoes, street lamps pop and blossom like daisies, and the very ground shifts like a rug on a polished floor.  As distortions grow stronger, you wonder if the changes can possibly be reversed.
back_text: Choose the [[Arkham]] location that is closest to Arkham Asylum that does not have the <t>Wonderland</t>trait.  Flip that location to its <t>Wonderland</t>side and place 1<per> clues on it.  Each investigator at that location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. If each [[Arkham]] location in play also has the [[Wonderland]] trait, each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).  Otherwise, flip this agenda back to its 'a' side.
flavor: Strange waves of distortion sweep over Arkham, devolving it quickly into chaos.  The city is rapidly being warped and blended with the Wonderland of Alice's dreams.  Buildings and landmarks distort into unfamiliar forms, while the people unfortunate enough to be caught in these ripples are likewise distorted.  You hope that you can find some way to stop or reverse these changes before you yourself are transformed by the events.
name: A Tide of Madness

back_flavor: The cat appears again on a tree limb just above you, grinning as ever.  "Truth is far more true when found than told," it purrs, "but the shadows are growing long.  Don't you think it's time you went home?  Not your home, of course, but Alice's.  It's in the neighborhood, you see."
back_text: Put the set-aside Abandoned House into play. The lead investigator must immediately take control of the set-aside The Cheshire Cat (Grinning Guide) card. Shuffle the set-aside Cheshire Cat encounter set into the encounter deck.
flavor: You question the strange cat, but it speaks in circular logic and nonsensical terms.  You get the feeling that it is testing you rather than helping you.  If you want actual answers on how to stop Gurathnaka, you'll have to scour the city and watch the changes up-close.
name: Sphinx's Riddle

back_flavor: You open the door to the quaint house and step inside hesitantly.  The rooms are mostly bare, and what little furniture remains is covered with dusty white sheets.  The whole search seems more futile by the moment until you enter a room whose only furnishing is a large mirror on the mantle above a fireplace. Curiously, the mirror's surface ripples intermittently, and through it you can see an entirely different room.  As you approach for a closer look, the scratching of paws on the old wooden floor directs your attention back to the hall behind you.  A white rabbit dressed in old Victorian clothing dashes away, clutching a pocket watch and mumbling to itself.  You won't get a chance to investigate both before Arkham unravels completely.
back_text: The investigators must decide (choose one): - We have to find out what that rabbit is up to. Put the set-aside The White Rabbit into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a - Follow the White Rabbit. - We have to figure out how to get inside that mirror. Put the set-aside The Looking-Glass into play at Abandoned House. Advance to Act 3a - Through the Looking-Glass.
flavor: Amid the chaotic overlap of this other world, an English country house has appeared in the neighborhood just south of you.  If what the cat suggested is true, then the key to stopping these worlds from merging lies inside.
name: House Sitting
text: Objective - After an investigator enters the Abandoned House, advance.

back_flavor: Following the rabbit is no easy task.  It moves rapidly through the unstable terrain without sparing a moment to notice you.  You nearly lose track of it in a thick tangle of bushes, but finally catch a glimpse of the rabbit leaping down a hole.  You approach the rabbit hole in exasperation, wondering how to proceed, but as you stand there, the hole slowly widens to a much larger and seemingly bottomless pit.  You look to the cat for advice, but it merely grins, waiting for you to act.  Foolish as it seems, you steel your nerves and leap into the pit.
flavor: The white rabbit seems to have the one thing you're looking for amid the constantly twisting landscape: purpose.  If there's any method to this madness, you'll find it wherever the rabbit is headed.
name: Follow the White Rabbit
text: Objective - If there are at least 3[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.

back_flavor: You slowly begin to notice patterns in the distortions sweeping over Arkham.  There are moments when the boundaries between the two worlds weaken.  You spend some time learning the rhythm and quirks of the distortions before returning to the abandoned house.  With proper timing, you leap forward as the mirror's surface ripples, and you pass through it completely as if diving through water.
flavor: If there's anything that's clear about the state of Arkham, it's that Wonderland is the source of it.  If you're going to have any real chance of stopping the chaos, you'll have to get to that world through the mirror.
name: Through the Looking-Glass
text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no clues on locations: Place 1 clues on Abandoned House from the token bank. Objective - After each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

flavor: The odd cake and drink caused you to grow and shrink whenever you used them. This could come in handy.
name: Strange Refreshments
text:
Uses (4 portions). If Strange Refreshments has no portions on it, discard it.
[fast] Exhaust Strange Refreshments and spend 1 portion: You get +2 [combat] or +2 [agility] for this skill test.

flavor: The booklet is filled with a series of strange but insightful poems, all written completely backwards.
name: Looking-Glass Book
text:
Uses (4 poems). If Looking-Glass Book has no poems on it, discard it.
[fast] Exhaust Looking-Glass Book and spend 1 poem: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [intellect] for this skill test.

flavor: Dreams within dreams, and none of them quite making sense.
name: The Dormouse
text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
[reaction] After you draw a non-weakness card from your deck, exhaust The Dormouse: Shuffle that card back into your deck and draw another card.

flavor:
If you need to get out of danger quickly,
the Knave might be around or he might not be.
name: The Knave of Hearts
text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] When you reveal a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt, exhaust The Knave of Hearts: Cancel that attack or evasion attempt.

name: Executioner's Axe
text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [elder_thing] token is revealed during this attack, you may either treat that token's modifier as 0 or deal +1 additional damage (choose one).

flavor: With the confidence he carries, one might assume that he knows what he's doing.
name: The Bellman
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to lose any amount of resources, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 damage to him: You ignore that part of the effect.
[reaction] When a card effect would force you to discard any amount of cards from your hand, exhaust The Bellman and deal 1 horror to him: You ignore that part of the effect.

flavor: 'One, two! One, two! And through and through!'
name: Vorpal Blade
text: [action] Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [elder_sign], [bless], +1, or 0 token is revealed during this attack, you may either heal 1 horror or deal an additional +1 damage (choose one, if your target has the [[Monster]], [[Abomination]], or [[Shadow]] traits, you may choose both instead).

name: Tweedles' Rattle
text: [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Investigate. Ignore all effects that increase your location's shroud for this test. [action] Exhaust Tweedles' Rattle: Evade. If your target has the [[Monster]], [[Abomination]], or [[Shadow]] traits, you get +2 [agility] for this test.

name: Tenebrous Nightmares
text: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Nightmares into play in your threat area. You cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase. [action][action]: Discard Tenebrous Nightmare.
